pages.description: Comprehensive structural notes sheet containing the 2022 CBC fastening schedule (Table 2304.10.2), concrete specifications, foundation notes, general structural notes, structural wood specifications with lumber grade table, rebar specifications with cover table, and seismic/wind design criteria. This is the primary structural reference sheet for the project.
key_content: 2022 CBC Table 2304.10.2 Fastening Schedule — full nailing schedule for all framing connections (29+ line items)
Concrete: 2,500 PSI min at 28 days (flatwork), 3,000 PSI for walls, grade beams, and caissons; ASTM C150 Type II cement; ASTM C33 aggregates; 4" max slump for flatwork
Foundation: bearing pressure = 1500 PSF; footing depth at least 24 inches below lowest adjacent finished grade into competent soil
Structural wood: Douglas Fir-Larch, PS20-25; Joists & Planks No. 2; Beams & Stringers No. 1; Post and Timbers No. 1
Parallam (PSL): 2.0E WS (2900 Fb) and 2.2E WS (2900 Fb); Microllam (LVL): 2.0E WS (2900 Fb)
2x4 studs 8'-0" long: No. 1; 2x4 studs 8'-1" to 14'-0": No. 1; 2x6 studs: No. 2
Sill plates: pressure treated Douglas Fir (P.T.D.F.) with hot-dipped zinc galvanized or stainless steel fasteners (ASTM A153)
Plywood: APA Structural 1 rated sheathing with exterior glue, per DOC PS1 or PS2
Hardware: Simpson Company or engineer approved equal
Machine bolts: ASTM A307 Grade A; Anchor bolts: ASTM F1554 Grade 36; Nuts: ASTM A563 Hex Grade A; Threaded rods: ASTM A36; Washers: ASTM F436

key_content: Title 24 Notes: 23 numbered notes covering compliance/operating/maintenance/ventilation information, appliance efficiency, water heater temperature controls, insulation, fenestration air infiltration, formaldehyde limits
Note 1: Compliance Information — builder shall leave copies of completed compliance documents [10-103(b)1]
Note 2: Operating Information — operating information in folder/manual with all certificates [10-103(b)2]
Note 5: All systems/equipment/appliances comply with Sections 110.0 through 110.11 for newly constructed buildings
Note 7: Service water-heating systems equipped with automatic temperature controls per ASHRAE Table 3, Chapter 50 [110.3(a)1]
Note 11: Unfired water-heater storage tanks: External insulation R-12 minimum, or internal+external R-16, or heat loss less than 6.5 Btu/hr per sq ft [110.3(c)4]
Note 13: Continuously burning pilot lights prohibited for natural gas furnaces, cooking appliances (except <150 Btu/hr), pool/spa heaters [110.5]
Note 15: Manufactured fenestration air infiltration rates not exceeding 0.3 cfm/ft2 window area [110.6(a)1]
Note 16: Fenestration rated per NFRC 100 for U-factor, NFRC 200 for SHGC [110.6(a)2]
Note 18: Joints, penetrations sealed to limit infiltration and exfiltration [110.7]
Note 19: Insulation certified by Dept of Consumer Affairs, Bureau of Home Furnishing and Thermal Insulation [110.8(a)]
Note 20: Urea formaldehyde foam insulation — exterior side walls only, requires 4-mil polyethylene vapor barrier [110.8(b)]
Note 23: External insulation on existing unfired water storage tank: R-12 minimum or heat loss <6.5 Btu/hr/sq ft [110.8(d)2]

Section E Residential Notes: fireplace requirements (closeable doors, combustion air intake, flue damper) [150.0(e)1], setback thermostat [150.0(i)], gas water heater requirements (120V receptacle within 3 ft, Category III/IV vent, condensate drain, 200,000 Btu/hr gas line) [150.0(n)]
Section E Note 8: Hot water pipe insulation required — all pipes from heating source to kitchen, 3/4 inch+ diameter, first 5 feet from tank, recirculation piping, buried piping [150.0(c)2.A]
Section E Note 10: Lighting — luminaires classified high-efficacy per TABLE 150.0-A, exhaust fans switched separately, vacancy sensors in garages/laundry/utility rooms [150.0(k)]
2022 Single-Family Residential Mandatory Requirements Summary (5/6/22): six tiled panels

Building Envelope checklist: air leakage 0.3 CFM/sq ft per NFRC-400/ASTM E283, fenestration labeling NFRC U-factor/SHGC, insulation certification by BHGS, roofing solar reflectance per CF1R, radiant barrier, roof/ceiling insulation U-0.184 max, wall insulation R-13 min (2x4) or R-20 (2x6), raised-floor insulation R-19 min, slab edge insulation, vapor retarder in climate zones 1-16
Fireplaces/Gas Appliances checklist: pilot light prohibition, closeable doors, combustion intake, flue dampers [110.5]
HVAC checklist: efficiency/certification [110.1-110.4], heat pump space/water heating [150.0(h)], thermostats [110.2(c)], isolation valves [110.3(c)]
Ducts and Fans: space conditioning airflow 350 CFM/ton, air-handling unit fan efficacy 0.45 W/CFM gas furnace / 0.58 W/CFM others, small duct high velocity 250 CFM/ton at 0.62 W/CFM [150.0(m)13]

Ventilation: ASHRAE 62.2 compliance [150.0(o)1], CFI ventilation motorized damper [150.0(o)1B], whole-dwelling mechanical ventilation [150.0(o)1C], local mechanical exhaust kitchens/bathrooms [150.0(o)1G], MERV 13 filters
Pool/Spa: certification, 36 inches pipe between filter and heater, covers required, directional inlets, time switches, no continuously burning pilot [110.4, 110.5, 150.0(p)]
Lighting: controls per 110.9, luminaire efficacy TABLE 150.0-A, screw-based luminaires per JA8, recessed downlights airtight/sealed, blank electrical boxes limited to bedroom count [150.0(k)]

Solar Readiness: solar zone minimum 250 sq ft for single-family, azimuth 90-300 degrees, structural loads on construction documents, 200A minimum busbar, reserved space for double pole breaker marked 'For Future Solar Electric' [110.10]

Energy Storage System (ESS) Ready: 80A backup capacity or dedicated raceway, 4+ ESS branch circuits including refrigerator and sleeping room, 225A minimum panelboard busbar, space for isolation equipment/transfer switch within 3 ft [150.0(s)]
Heat Pump Space Heater Ready: dedicated 240V/30A circuit within 3 ft of furnace, blank cover '240V ready', reserved panel space 'For Future 240V use' [150.0(t)]
Electric Cooking Ready: dedicated 240V/50A circuit within 3 ft of cooktop, blank cover '240V ready', reserved panel space 'For Future 240V use' [150.0(v)]
Electric Clothes Dryer Ready: dedicated 240V/30A circuit within 3 ft of dryer, blank cover '240V ready', reserved panel space 'For Future 240V use' [150.0(v)]
Duct sealing and leakage test required per RA3.1 [150.0(m)11]
Air filtration: 2-inch minimum depth filter, MERV 13 or better, accessible for regular service [150.0(m)12]
